conformeR 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference

    Conformal inference with counterfactual methods for multi-condition single-cell data DE detection

    conformeR.Rd

    This function computes conformal prediction intervals and FDR-adjusted results for gene expression data stored in a SingleCellExperiment object. Results are aggregated at cell_type level.

    conformeR(
  sce,
  obs_condition,
  replicate_id,
  cell_type,
  spacing = 0.01,
  size_train = 0.5,
  size_cal = 0.25,
  cores = 32,
  cutoff = 0.05
)

    Arguments

    sce

    A SingleCellExperiment object containing gene expression data ("logcounts" assay).

    obs_condition

    Character scalar. The name of the column in colData(sce) indicating the observed condition (e.g., treatment vs control).

    replicate_id

    Character scalar. The name of the column in colData(sce) identifying biological replicates (e.g. patient ID).

    cell_type

    Character scalar. The name of the column in colData(sce) specifying cell types.

    spacing

    Numeric scalar. Grid spacing for prediction intervals computation. Default is 0.01.

    size_train

    Numeric scalar between 0 and 1. Proportion of data used for training. Default is 0.5.

    size_cal

    Numeric scalar between 0 and 1. Proportion of data used for calibration. Default is 0.25.

    cores

    Integer. Number of parallel workers for computation. Default is 32.

    Value

    A list with the following components:

    INT

    A tibble of conformal prediction intervals for each gene x cell x level of confidence.

    FDR

    A tibble summarizing combined FDR per gene and cell_type.

    Examples

    if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
library(SingleCellExperiment)
sce <- mock_sce_object()  # example input
res <- conformeR(sce, obs_condition="treatment",
                 replicate_id="patient_id", cell_type="celltype",
                 cores=4)
} # }
